sub_title: Nutrition Business Group Engineering & Manex Director
summary:
30 plus years of experience in the areas of Manufacturing, Projects, Manufacturing Excellence, Safety  and Quality Assurance in diverse sectors viz. Foods , Beverages , Home care , Personal care and oil refinery. Proven leadership skills in running large and complex manufacturing operations ,  building and leading large teams , developing and implementing world class practices and systems and networking across regional and global teams. Track record of  turning around many factories, consistently exceeding performance  & achieving best-in-class operating results. 

Specialties: 
Manufacturing operations management
Team building and coaching, FMCG, Supply Chain
Project Management
Transforming Manufacturing Operations 
Safety, Health and Environment
Quality Assurance
HR / IR

courses.name: Master Coach & Trainer on Behavioural Safety accredited by DuPont
Process Safety & Riask Assessment by DuPont
Project Management Course by Association for Project Management
Train the Trainer for developing Purpose

profile_positions.description: Responsible for Engineering & Manufacturing Excellence across Nutrition Factories across the Geography.  Inline with the overall Nutrition SC strategy, developing plans to deliver excellence in terms of improving Efficiency, reducing waste and creating resilience and Capacity to meet the business requirements. Key responsibility includes delivering Net Zero strategy in line with external commitments through decarbonising the manufacturing plants. Driving efficiency through automation, Digitalising factories and developing engineers to manage these automation.
profile_positions.title: Nutrition Business Group Engineering & Manex Director

profile_positions.description:
Led Engineering & Project for South Asia cluster of Hindustan Unilever Ltd. Setting up over all Engineering Strategy for the organization. Finalizing the Capital budget for entire South Asia Cluster and executing of projects across the network with an yearly capex of 165-185 Million Euro.  

Delivering Sustainability project to meet Decarbonisation plan and Executing Robotics & Automation to reduce the manual work. 

Developing future fit manufacturing sites with Automation to address non value added activities, planning for reducing utility cost across 30 plus factories and developing Digital plan for Supply chain
profile_positions.title: General Manager - Engineering & Projects , Hindustan Unilever Ltd - SA Cluster

profile_positions.description:
Responsible for developing and deploying leading edge engineering capability for Unilever. Led Core Design and Engineering Design (up to FEED) for the Capex Projects for Home and Personal Care Portfolio. 
Responsible for OTIF of project delivery that also enables the UE Value deliverables of reduced CAPEX, operating costs, environmental impact and accelerated project delivery. 

 Deliver design excellence in Unilever and lead the way in bringing external engineering excellence into Unilever to achieve competitive advantage in the Unilever Supply Chain.  Also responsible for are Process Engineering & Modularization, Packaging Engineering Capability, Utilities & Sustainability Technologies, Electrical and Control & Automation Engineering, Cost Engineering & Analysis and Facilities Engineering.
profile_positions.title: Design & Cost Engineering Director - Global Role

profile_positions.description:
Pondicherry factory of Hindustan Unilever Ltd is one of the largest Home & Personal Care Factory manufacturing multi category products ~ Soaps, Detergent bars, creams, Talcum powder, shampoos, dishwash bars, distilled fatty acids with 700 plus own employees, 600 contract employees, Capacity of 150000 Tons p.a. This complex has 6 plants with DFA plant and related utilities. Over all responsible for Capital investment of 250 Cr INR in progress for setting up new facilities.

Handled general operational responsibilities of the factory. Effective production planning and control, statutory and legal compliance, TPM & safety and Health & environment requirements, engineering activities and projects management, quality assurance, human resources and industrial relations, budgets and costs
